Name: Hot Gin Toddy
Ingredients: 7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Place bar spoon in empty (ideally warmed glass). POUR all ingredients into glass and then STIR.
Review: Warmed and sweetened gin with a hint of orange. (Others prefer a grapefruit zest garnish but there is no accounting.)
History: The first published reference to a Toddy was in England in 1741.
Nutrition: One serving of Hot Gin Toddy contains 151 calories
